definition: phonetic component of a Chinese character
mark/sign/talisman/to seal/to correspond to/tally/symbol/written charm/to coincide

sentences.english: The phonetic component of a Chinese character.
Studies on the source-indicating functions of phonetic complements in determinative-phonetic characters are of value to many fields of learning.
sentences.chinese: 研究形聲字聲符示源功能具有多方面的價值。

sentences.english: Fifthly, the meaning of pictophonetic character and that of phonetic sign have no relation.
sentences.chinese: 第五種，形聲字與聲符在意義上沒有關係。

definition: combined ideogram (one of the Six Methods 六書|六书 of forming Chinese characters)/Chinese character that combines the meanings of existing elements/also known as joint ideogram or associative compounds
to transliterate/to transcribe/to transfer words onto a surface by direct contact (as with a decal)
to polish a text/rhetoric/ornate language/to use florid language to conceal errors/to gloss over
see 呂洞賓|吕洞宾[Lu:3 Dong4 bin1]
Guliang Annals, commentary on the Spring and Autumn Annals 春秋[Chun1 qiu1], first published during the Han Dynasty
